glsa.title: FreeType 1: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities in FreeType might result in the remote execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: FreeType is a True Type Font rendering library.

description.p: Multiple issues found in FreeType 2 were also discovered in FreeType 1. For details on these issues, please review the Gentoo Linux Security Advisories and CVE identifiers referenced below.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted TTF file, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running FreeType.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All FreeType 1 users should upgrade to an unaffected version:
NOTE: This is a legacy GLSA. Updates for all affected architectures are available since May 27, 2009. It is likely that your system is already no longer affected by this issue.
